</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The valid certificate file required for the transfer.</dd><dt class="property-required property-replacement"
            title="Required">
        <span id="usage_csharp">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="certificatechain_csharp">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The optional list of certificate that make up the chain for the certificate that is being imported.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>A short description that helps identify the certificate.</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The private key associated with the certificate being imported.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">

<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#usage_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">usage</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies if a certificate is being used for signing or encryption. The valid values are SIGNING and ENCRYPTION.</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="certificatechain_nodejs">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>

            title="Optional">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>

            title="Optional">

## Look up Existing Certificate Resource {#look-up}

Get an existing Certificate resource's state with the given name, ID, and optional extra properties used to qualify the lookup.
<div>
<pulumi-chooser type="language" options="csharp,go,typescript,python,yaml,java"></pulumi-chooser>
</div>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="javascript,typescript">

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import Transfer AS2 Certificate using the `certificate_id`. For example:

```sh
$ pulumi import aws:transfer/certificate:Certificate example c-4221a88afd5f4362a
```


To learn more about importing existing cloud resources, see [Importing resources](/docs/using-pulumi/adopting-pulumi/import/).
